page.title: 03HISTORICAL BUILDINGS
page.content: {Beley Bridge }Built 1736, small single span bridge {Dunino Bridge} Built 1807. Single arch dated on East face. {Dunino Church }Built around 1240 {Dunino Churchyard and Walls }Large churchyard extended in 1940's. Walled.Original early 19th century gates. {Dunino Churchyard Sundial} Sculptured stone, largely effaced and of indeterminate date, reused as sundial, and incised with date 1698. {Dunino Manse }Built around 1820's. {Pittarthie Castle} Built or reconstructed in 1653. {Pot Hole, Dunino Den}- In Dunino Den, about 100 yards to the North West of the Churchyard, is what is called "The Pot Hole". It consists of a circular depression worked in the rock surface, 4 feet 6 inches in diameter, and
